title: 104_hr3174
content: The "Women and HIV Outreach and Prevention Act" is cited as the short title. It amends Title XXV of the Public Health Service Act to include preventive health programs for women regarding HIV. This includes providing preventive health services. The Secretary may grant funds for preventive health services related to HIV for women, including education, testing, and linkage to care services, as well as appropriate referrals for other services. The provision of various services to women receiving services includes referrals for HIV treatment, substance abuse treatment, mental health services, pregnancy and childbirth, pediatric care, housing, public assistance, job training, child care, respite care, reproductive health care, and domestic violence. Follow-up services for referrals, improving referral arrangements, providing services to partners, and ensuring the specified services are delivered. The Secretary may grant funds for outreach and training services related to women's health, with qualifications for grantees to be public or nonprofit entities serving low-income women. Confidentiality of individual information is required for grant applicants. The Secretary may grant funds for outreach and training services related to women's health, with qualifications for grantees to be public or nonprofit entities serving low-income women. Grant applications must comply with applicable laws and include necessary agreements, assurances, and information. Evaluations of projects will be conducted by the Secretary or contracted entities, with reports submitted to Congress annually. The Secretary will submit an annual report to Congress summarizing evaluations of projects related to women's health. Authorization of appropriations is set at $30,000,000 for fiscal year 1997, with additional funding for subsequent years for grants to various entities. For fiscal year 1997, $20,000,000 is authorized for grants to entities not grantees under section 1001, with additional funding for fiscal years 1998 and 1999 as needed. "SEC. 2532. PUBLIC EDUCATION." The Secretary may grant funds for HIV prevention education programs targeting women, focusing on transmission modes like sexual contact, IV drug use, and maternal-fetal transmission. Grantees must be experienced in women's health activities, with priority given to those serving women of color. Applications for grants must meet specified requirements set by the Secretary. The Secretary ensures women's representation in HIV Planning Councils and allocates resources for their inclusion. Evaluations of projects are conducted, and reports are submitted to Congress annually. The Secretary submits annual reports to Congress summarizing project evaluations and authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 1997, 1998, and 1999. SEC. 3. Treatment of women for substance abuse. This section amends the Public Health Service Act to address the treatment of women for substance abuse. The Director of the Center for Substance Abuse Treatment may award grants for programs providing substance abuse treatment, counseling on AIDS prevention, and counseling for partners of abusers. $20,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 1997, with additional funding for 1998 and 1999. SEC. 4. EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES FOR WOMEN. Amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize $20,000,000 for fiscal year 1997 for grants to provide early intervention services for women.
